title: Holkham Hall
summary: Holkham Hall (/ˈhoʊkəm/ or /ˈhɒlkəm/[1]) is an 18th-century country house located adjacent to the village of Holkham, Norfolk, England. The house was constructed in the Palladian style for the 1st Earl of Leicester (fifth creation)[2][3] by the architect William Kent, aided by the architect and aristocrat Lord Burlington.
